item.description:
"We are meeting at the Lenox Hotel (address above). Look for the Canadian flag."

The Greek Independence Day Parade will take place on April 7 at 1:00pm. It will run along Boylston Street, downtown Boston, where many groups in traditional Greek attire, philharmonic bands and many participating societies will parade, proudly waiving the Greek and American flags.

The Greek War of Independence was a successful war of independence waged by the Greek revolutionaries between 1821 and 1832, with later assistance from Russia, the United Kingdom, France, and several other European powers against the Ottoman Empire, who were assisted by their vassals, the Eyalet of Egypt, and partly by the Vilayet of Tunisia. Come celebrate freedom with us on April 7.

Following the Parade on the Boston Common (corner of Boylston & Charles Street at the Parkman Bandstand) the Greek community will be hosting festivities, music and Greek traditional dancing in ethnic costumes. Plus, lots and lots of food!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, go to the website at: http://www.worldwidegreeks.com/events/2013-greek-independence-day-parade-boston

ΖΗΤΑ ΕΛΛΑΣ!

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: Greek Independence Day Parade Boston 2013
